title: Smashing Pumpkins - 2007/07/18 complete audio (four source mix)
description:
Smashing Pumpkins
July 18th, 2007
The Fillmore
San Francisco, CA, US

multi-source mix by rhinowing
complete show (almost-missing four seconds)

-----------
Source One: Sony ECM-959DT -> Sony MZ-R3
Transfer: MD(M) -> Sony MDS-JE520 -> Optical Cable -> Harmon Kardon CDR2 -> CDR(1) -> EAC -> Data Disc (-> dEdit -> FLAC)
Recorded and Transfered by The Manwich Brothers (another Drop A Deuce production)
-----------

-----------
Source Two: Unknown camera
Transfer: Video Master (probably MiniDV) -> DVD -> 48khz .mp3 files -> .WAV (downsampled to 44.1khz with r8brain on "very high" quality setting)
(the fragmentary front-row video from Ginger&#039;s side that appeared on The Pirate&#039;s Bay in late 2007)
-----------

-----------
Source Three: Sony Cybershot DSC-T30 
Transfer: .AVI files -> Authored -> DVDr(1) -> .VOB -> TMPGEnc (demux) -> 48khz/192kpbs .AC3 file -> .WAV (downsampled to 44.1khz with r8brain on "very high" quality setting)
(shot by Manwich Bros from about halfway back on the floor, Jeff&#039;s side--they sent DVDs of this to me)
-----------

-----------
Source Four: Sony HDR-SR5
Transfer: AVCHD Video Master -> 48khz WAV files -> me -> .WAV (downsampled to 44.1khz with r8brain on "very high" quality setting)
(MonteLDS&#039;s HD video, shot from the balcony, thanks to Monte for getting this to me)
-----------

Editing performed:
Audacity (fades and source mixes), CDWave (splits), FLAC Frontend (level 8, align on sector boundaries)

***PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS FILESET CONTAINS AUDIO FROM LOSSY SOURCES, INCLUDING MPEG AND AC3. THIS WAS DONE IN INTEREST OF ASSEMBLING A COMPLETE SHOW***

01. Intro (Surprisia theme) - 2:22
02. Gossamer - 26:43
03. Today - 3:32
04. Stand Inside Your Love - 3:53
05. Zero - 2:16
06. United States -> Star Spangled Banner [Key] (tease) - 11:26
07. Neverlost - 5:04
08. Drown - 5:00
09. Hummer - 6:43
10. Bullet with Butterfly Wings - 5:45
11. Blue Skies Bring Tears - 7:52
12. With Every Light - 5:17
13. If All Goes Wrong - 4:13
14. (banter - the keyboard is broken) - 1:53
15. Thirty-three - 3:46
16. To Sheila - 4:14
17. Blister in the Sun [Violent Femmes] (tease) - 1:23
18. Tonight, Tonight - 4:59
19. Tarantula - 4:09
20. Starz - 4:53
21. Starla - 7:57
Encore One:
22. That&#039;s the Way (My Love Is) - 4:52
23. Heavy Metal Machine -> White Rabbit [Jefferson Airplane] (tease) - 8:55
Encore Two:
24. Death from Above - 4:58
25. Shame - 5:35
26. (guitar improv/banter - newspaper reviewers) - 4:47
27. Silverfuck -> The End [The Doors] (tease) - 11:33

Source breakdown:
Tracks 1-10 are source 1
Tracks 11 starts with source 2, then switches to source 1
Tracks 12-21 are source 1
Track 22 starts with source 1, then switches to source 3
Track 23 starts with source 3, then switches to 2, then back to 3
Tracks 24 is source 4
Tracks 25-26 are source 1
Track 27 starts with source 1, then ends with source 4

Flaws:
Shame is brickwalled
Silverfuck is really rough quality
One small cut (roughly four seconds, around 4:55 in the song) remains in Heavy Metal Machine, which I was unable to patch without a really jarring transition. It sounded better left alone.
The portion of Blue Skies Bring Tears from source 2, That&#039;s the Way, Heavy Metal Machine, and the portion of Silverfuck from source 4 are all in dual-mono

www.smashingpumpkins.com

Don&#039;t sell this. If you sell this, a pidgeon will get you.
